p: There are multiple species of Brucella that may cause human disease. Acquired from contaminated sheep, pigs, cattle, and goat, clinical manifestations comprise an acute onset of fever, abdominal discomfort, and jaundice. Noncaseating hepatic granulomas are identified on biopsy. Surgical drainage of the abscesses may be required and a combination of streptomycin and doxycycline is used for treatment [ 16â€“ 18].
